intro: Octomeria gemmula, commonly known as the gemmulated octomeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Octomeria gemmula is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
